Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD applied the correct standard of review to RPD's credibility findings
Evidence_Assessment: RAD failed to independently reassess evidence; focused only on reviewing RPD decision
Decision_Outcome: RPD rejected claim, RAD upheld decision
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to establish refugee status under IRPA
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's credibility regarding persecution based on religious beliefs in Iran
Legal_Rule: Reasonableness standard applies to judicial review of RAD decisions
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard for mixed questions of fact and law
Procedural_Issue: RAD did not conduct independent appeal analysis
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution in Iran due to religious beliefs
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed by RPD and RAD
Decision_Maker: Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RAD's approach was procedurally unfair due to lack of independent analysis
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's testimony regarding religious persecution in Iran
Legal_Framework: IRPA sections 96, 97, 110(4), 110(6), and section 72(1) for judicial review
Applicant_Challenge: RAD failed to properly apply standard of review and re-evaluate credibility
Court_Result: Federal Court granted judicial review and remitted case to RAD
Remedy_Requested: Reconsideration by RAD with proper standard of review
Outcome: Case remitted to RAD for reevaluation
Remedy_Sought: Remittal to RAD for proper appeal analysis
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged persecution based on religion in Iran
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection division hearing, appeal to RAD, judicial review
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Reconsideration of refugee claim by RAD
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness standard governs review of administrative decisions under IRPA
